intro: Draba cocuyana, commonly known as the Cocuyan rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has basal leaves that are usually lobed or divided, and its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Draba cocuyana is often found in high-altitude regions, where it adapts to cold and harsh climatic conditions.
